title: Luminary Curator's Choice: David Hockney—The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020
title_display: Curator's Choice: David Hockney—The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020
short_description: Luminary members are invited to a private introduction to David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020 with Robyn Farrell, associate curator, Modern and Contemporary Art. This event is open exclusively to Luminary members.
list_description: Luminary members are invited to a private introduction to David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020 with Robyn Farrell, associate curator, Modern and Contemporary Art. This event is open exclusively to Luminary members.
description:
Luminary members are invited to a private introduction to David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020. Robyn Farrell, associate curator, Modern and Contemporary Art, will explore the optimism of the exhibition and contextualize this most recent series within Hockney’s six-decade practice. The conversation will be followed by an exhibition viewing and reception of wine and light hors d'oeuvres.

This event is open exclusively to Luminary members.

David Hockney is an English painter, draftsman, printmaker, stage designer, and photographer. An important contributor to the Pop Art movement of the 1960s, he is considered one of the most influential British artists of the 20th century.

Robyn Farrell is an associate curator in the department of Modern and Contemporary Art at the Art Institute of Chicago. Since joining the department in 2013, she has served on the curatorial teams for Frances Stark: Intimism (2015), Andy Warhol—From A to B and Back Again (2019), and Barbara Kruger's THINKING OF YOU. I MEAN ME. I MEAN YOU. (2021), among many others. Robyn’s research interests include conceptual art and the moving image, emerging disciplines of media art, artist networks, and the history of exhibition and distribution of film and video.

Event details and an RSVP link will be emailed to members at the Luminary Bronze level and above. Memberships can be purchased or renewed online. If you would like to upgrade an existing membership, please reach out to us at luminary@artic.edu.

This event is exclusive to Luminary members, and advance registration is required. Questions? Please reach out to us at luminary@artic.edu.

So that you can enjoy your experience safely, all museum visiting policies at the time of the event must be observed.
location: Modern Wing: Gallery 289 and Balcony Café
